subject: Negotiation
title: Saving Face in Asian Negotiations
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Saving Face in Asian Negotiations.

hook.text: Saying 'You're wrong' in a meeting in Seoul can end a deal that took months to build.

buildup.text: Face is a person's social reputation and dignity. Losing face in public is deeply humiliating in Asian cultures.

discovery.text: Direct criticism, public disagreement, and putting someone on the spot all cause loss of face.

twist.text: A negotiator who makes the other side lose face won't just lose the deal â€” they'll lose future deals too.

climax.text: Give criticism privately. Offer praise publicly. Let the other side look good in front of their team.

punchline.text: Protect their face and they'll protect the deal.

quiz.question: What does 'saving face' mean in Asian negotiations?
options: Protecting someone's social reputation and dignity
